Crash Triggering: Sending malformed packets to crash charger firmware
Triggering buffer overrun in communication handler
Buffer Overrun: Exploiting unchecked input in protocol parsing
Overflowing charger memory via crafted payloads

Session Hijack: Replaying session tokens for unauthorized access
Man-in-the-Middle: Intercepting charger-EV communication for sensitive data
Manipulating data in transit to leak user information

Tampered Update File: Supplying malicious firmware update via insecure channel
Modifying update package to inject backdoor
Rollback Attack: Forcing charger to install outdated vulnerable firmware
Exploiting lack of update integrity checks
Malicious Binary Injection: Injecting unauthorized code into charger firmware
Replacing legitimate firmware with attacker-controlled binary

Protocol Misuse: Roll Jam Attack on Rolling Codes

Tampered Update File: Malicious OTA Update
Update File Replacement
